snippet: After a failed coup in July, soldiers and police officers were among the latest cull, accused of links to terrorism or of acting against national security....
abstract: Turkish government dismisses additional 15,000 civil servants and shutters 375 organizations, including over nine news organizations, in continued crackdown on dissent; dismissals add to 100,000 already fired amid accusations of involvement in attempted coup.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and SAFAK TIMUR
byline.contributor: James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: After a failed coup in July, soldiers and police officers were among the latest cull, accused of links to terrorism or of acting against national security.

headline.main: 15,000 More Public Workers Are Fired in Turkey Crackdown
headline.print_headline: Turkey Fires 15,000 More Public Workers in Crackdown

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
